page.title: 19TOURISM IN DEERNESS (2)
page.content: Boat trips start from Skaill which can take you to the{Brough of Deerness, the Gloup, around the Mull Head and to the island of Copinsay. The{Gloup}is a huge sea cavern open to the sky, connected to the sea by a passage through the rocks. The boat glides through the narrow entrance, then into the heart of the rock, which rises sheer to the sunlight above. The{Mull {Head}with vertical sea cliffs has colonies of kittiwakes, shags, razorbills and puffins. Photographers can obtain delightful pictures. The {Island of Copinsay,}now owned by{RSPB is a bird reserve. Large colonies of sea-birds are also found here. The lighthouse, built during World War 1, is being modernised with a view to being automated and demanned.
